required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole vs Levofloxacin as Targeted Therapy for Stenotrophomonas Maltophilia Infections: a Retrospective Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole or Levofloxacin? A Retrospective Cohort Study of Targeted Therapy for Stenotrophomonas Maltophilia Blood Stream and Lower Respiratory Tract Infections

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)

clinical_study.source: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to compare mortality outcomes of levofloxacin and trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole treated patients who have Stenotrophomonas maltophilia blood stream or lower respiratory tract infections by retrospectively analyzing a propensity-matched cohort from a large dataset of electronic health record data.

primary_outcome.description: Patient died or discharged to hospice

secondary_outcome.description: Mean hospital length of stay, where mortality will be censored as longest possible length of stay

arm_group.description: Patients with Stenotrophomonas maltophilia bacteremia or lower respiratory tract infection who received Levofloxacin from day of culture positivity (day 0) through day +7.
Patients with Stenotrophomonas maltophilia bacteremia or lower respiratory tract infection who received TMP/SMX from day of culture positivity (day 0) through day +7.

study_pop.textblock: Adult inpatients with Stenotrophomonas maltophilia blood stream or lower respiratory tract infection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age and older
- Stenotrophomonas maltophilia culture positive from blood or the following specified respiratory tract sites: sputum, tracheal aspirate, bronchoalveolar lavage and protected bronchial brush washings
- Received either levofloxacin or TMP/SMX targeted therapy
- Those patients that received empiric therapy with a consistent medication (for example, levofloxacin empirically in the levofloxacin targeted therapy cohort) were included
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received antimicrobial other than TMP/SMX and levofloxacin, with known activity against Stenotrophomonas maltophilia (the list of antimicrobials that fit this exclusion criteria is: erythromycin, moxifloxacin, ciprofloxacin, minocycline, tigecycline, doxycycline, eravacycline, ceftazidime, cefepime, ticarcillin-clavulanate, cefiderocol, colistin, and chloramphenicol)
- Received inconsistent empiric therapy (for example, levofloxacin empirically in the TMP/SMX targeted therapy cohort) will be excluded from analysis
- Cystic fibrosis code present
- Organism resistant to therapy received

facility.name: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)
responsible_party.investigator_title: Staff Clinician, Critical Care Medicine Department

clinical_study.keyword: Stenotrophomonas maltophilia, Stenotrophomonas, Levofloxacin, TMP/SMX, Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole
